messages.content: Hello! I'm here to help you identify which tax credits and deductions you may be eligible for in Illinois. To get started, could you tell me about your current situation? For example: - Are you employed and if so, what's your approximate annual income? - Do you own a home or rent? - Do you have any children or dependents? - Did you make any charitable contributions or have educational expenses this year?
Hi, I am a software engineer and make 40k

Thank you for letting me know about your employment and income. To better assist you with identifying eligible tax credits and deductions, I have a few more questions: 1. Do you rent or own your home? 2. Are you single, married, or head of household? 3. Do you have any children or other dependents? 4. Did you have any educational expenses this year? 5. Did you make any charitable contributions? 6. Do you live in a specific enterprise zone or development area in Illinois?
I rent an apartment and am filing as single. I have no children and only a few education expenses like traveling to campus

You mentioned having some education expenses for traveling to campus. Are you currently a student? If so, could you tell me: 1. What type of educational institution you're attending (K-12, college, etc.)? 2. Approximately how much did you spend on educational expenses this year? 3. Is your school located in Illinois?
I am in a PhD program but I am about to drop out. Still technically in it but I go about once a month and it costs about $300 per trip

A few more questions to help determine your eligibility for credits: 1. Given your income of $40,000, do you have any other sources of income besides your software engineering job? 2. How much do you pay in rent monthly? 3. Do you have any retirement account contributions or investments? This will help me determine if you qualify for the Earned Income Tax Credit and other potential deductions.
I pay $2100 for rent, and I have no other sources of income. I have no retirement contributions
